p: Several reports indicated the potential antiproliferative activity of several peptide fractions derived from different fish species, as it was compiled in the work of Wang et al. [ 69]. Furthermore, the lipid fraction of white shrimp ( Litopenaeus setiferus) contains compounds that have been found to reduce the proliferation of a B-cell lymphoma cell line. Besides, shrimp anti-lipopolysaccharide factor (SALF) from black tiger shrimp ( Penaeus monodon), enhancing the anticancer activity of cisplatin in vitro and inhibiting HeLa cell growth in nude mice [ 69].
